verbs.description: unsurplice (third-person singular simple present unsurplices, present participle unsurplicing, simple past and past participle unsurpliced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To remove the surplice (and associated religious status) from.
examples: If a Wesleyan member in Parliament has the power to unsurplice the priests and deacons of the Church of England, the member of the Church of England may hang the cope upon the shoulders of the Conference.
